activities.name: Museum
activities.description: Museums can provide memorable, immersive learning experiences, provoke imagination, introduce unknown worlds and subject matter, and offer unique environments for quality time with family.

activities.name: Swimming Pool
activities.description: water activities are great ways to encourage your children to become more active. And the best thing is that they won't even know notice — they'll be too busy having fun.

activities.name: Make Slime
activities.description: Making slime with your kids is the best way to spend some hours of quality time with your family while having some fun and creative talks.

activities.name: Playground
activities.description: Playgrounds are safe spaces where kids develop crucial physical, social, emotional and imaginative skills necessary to gain self-confidence, improve coordination, and advance critical thinking capabilities.

activities.name: Family Game Day
activities.description: a family game day provides an opportunity for children to bond with siblings, parents and family members as well as peers. It can promote tradition building and establish a fun routine. Additionally, game days help children develop social skills such as following rules, taking turns, and graceful winning or losing.

activities.name: Tummy Time
activities.description: Supervised tummy time is important because it helps to: Strengthen baby's neck, shoulder, and arm muscles so the baby can start to sit up, crawl, and eventually walk on their own.

activities.name: Sensory Development
activities.description: Sensory play encourages learning through exploration, curiosity, problem solving and creativity.

activities.name: Take a walk
activities.description: Family walks open up new forms of conversations dependent on the environment, offer a safe space for your child to decompress, and show your littles the importance of initiating regular bonding time with loved ones. If walking offers all these great benefits, why do families naturally gravitate towards the couch?

activities.name: Camping
activities.description: Camping is also a great opportunity to teach your children new skills. When you go camping, you’re forced to disconnect from technology. This can be a good thing! It gives you the opportunity to talk and interact with your family without any distractions. If you have teenagers, this is an excellent way to get them to put down their phones and pay attention to the world around them.

activities.name: Arcade
activities.description: playing at the arcade can be a great experience for kids as it helps them hone social skills and boosts their self-esteem. Arcades offer various video game choices

activities.name: Theme Park
activities.description: Amusement parks can offer kid-sized thrill rides as well as daredevil experiences for older children and adults. Theme parks provide adventure, enjoyment, and memories that will last for a lifetime!
